question.questionA: Shrubby perennials; corolla with reflexed lobes; fruit bristly, beaked.
question.questionB: Herbaceous perennials; corolla with spreading lobes.

question.questionA: Climbing perennials; leaves strongly cordate; inflorescence exceeding the leaves; flowers white or pink.
question.questionB: Erect perennials; leaves ovate, cuneate, rounded or weakly cordate; inflorescence well short of leaves; flowers greenish, yellowish white or dark red.

question.questionA: Leaves rounded or weakly cordate; inflorescence obviously stalked; flowers greenish or yellowish white.
question.questionB: Leaves cuneate; inflorescence apparently sessile; flowers dark red.
